text:
Hi I'm one of the developers for a site using the free version of HS forms, and it seems that the checkbox field does not comply with accessibility standards as far as allowing a user with mobile disabilities (that is unable to use a mouse) navigate to the checkbox with a keyboard and check the box with a keyboard.

It looks the element that wraps these checkbox inputs is `class="hs-dependent-field"`

Presumably, this is an issue effecting any user of this type of HS form. I wanted to make a request, that when possible, could code be incorporated into the HTML that would include tabindex="0" so that the checkbox is keyboard navigable and able to be checked with a keyboard to comply with accessibility standards.

Thanks!!
